product_overview: APAS Intranet is a centralized internal management system designed for a healthcare organization, aiming to streamline communication, resource management, and administrative workflows across multiple departments including HR, IT, Maintenance, and Education.
core_goals: Centralize institutional information and improve internal communication.
Digitalize Human Resources processes such as paystub delivery and time tracking.
Automate and streamline internal service requests for IT, Maintenance, and hospital equipment.
Provide an integrated platform for employee education, training, and certification.
key_features: Secure user authentication with CPF login and password management, including recovery and reset.
Institutional unified calendar supporting event management and resource reservations for projectors and notebooks with automated IT ticketing.
Human Resources module for managing employee documents, digital paystubs, and digital clock-in with supervisor validation.
IT Support ticketing system with tracking, a knowledge base of technical articles, and hardware reservation visibility.
Education platform featuring course catalogs, video lessons, quizzes, and automatic certificate generation.
Maintenance and CEH modules for handling infrastructure and hospital equipment service requests.
Corporate communication tools including a digital mural for announcements, inter-user messaging, and employee birthday listings.
Comprehensive administration panel for system settings, user roles, sectors, and permissions management.
user_flow_summary: User logs in securely with CPF and password, utilizing password recovery options if needed.
Users access the dashboard as a central hub for navigation and overview of relevant information.
Employees view and reserve resources on the institutional agenda; reservation triggers automatic IT support ticket if hardware is involved.
HR users manage employee documents, send direct messages, and validate digital clock-ins.
IT department staff submit and manage support tickets, consult upcoming hardware reservations, and access a searchable knowledge base.
Users browse and participate in courses, take assessments, and receive certificates on successful completion.
Maintenance requests are submitted and handled through dedicated modules for infrastructure and hospital equipment.
Administrators manage users, sectors, permissions, and system-wide logs through a secure backend.
validation_criteria: All authentication flows (login, logout, password changes, recovery) must be secure and verified.
Resource reservation system correctly blocks double bookings and triggers IT tickets as designed.
HR document delivery and digital time tracking are accurate and access-controlled.
Support tickets can be created, updated, and resolved with status visible to users and IT staff.
Educational assessments must reliably grade and issue certificates upon course completion.
Maintenance and CEH requests are properly recorded and processed with status updates.
Communication modules display announcements and messages timely and securely.
Administration tasks enforce role-based permissions and audit logging to ensure security and traceability.
